CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas Hancock, 3316 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "Generally, the acquisition of money receives more recognition."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thomas Hancock, wearing moustache, eyeglasses, light colored button down coat, dark suit jacket, dark button down striped collared shirt, and light colored hat with dark band, standing in front of store sign inscribed "S...ved...choice...", right store window displaying Dr. Grabow pre-smoked pipes,  Rogers waterproof lighters, and Schick razors, exterior concrete wall with fire escape ladder on left
